title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING FOR IMPROVED GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: National authorities, in partnership with relevant stakeholders, have the capacity to generate, analyse and use relevant disaggregated data and knowledge on child rights issues for evidence-based policies and monitoring., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: National policies affecting children and adolescents and their families (especially those from Roma communities and those with disabilities) are evidence-based, equitable and adequately financed.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Building global / regional / national stakeholder research capacity
CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National authorities, in partnership with relevant stakeholders, have the capacity to generate, analyse and use relevant disaggregated data and knowledge on child rights issues for evidence-based policies and monitoring.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued monitoring of the situation of children, with a focus on vulnerable children, led to the mapping of available data on SDG child-related indicators, freshly generated data on Roma children. As a result of UNICEF advocacy, the Ombudsman Institution initiated the accreditation process as a National Human Rights Institution in line with Paris Principles. The capacity of the Child Ombudsman staff was assessed and tools for training were made available | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2019

title.narrative: Quality evidence and analysis on key child issues are generated on time by UNICEF
Independent National Human Rights Institution (NHRI) is in place in compliance with the Paris Principles with a child rights mandate

actual.value: 2020:A MoU for 2020-2022 signed with the Ombudsman Institution that defines collaboration with the Child Ombudsman and a joint workplan for 2020-2021. Consultation of the Child Ombudsman with Children's Board.

title.narrative: data on children disaggregated by rural/urban, gender, age, disability, ethnicity and income quintile

actual.value: 2020:TransMonEE datasheets were completed. Advocacy work for conducting a MICS in Romania.
